Before encountering a lot of lobster stories from Dr. Jordan Peterson’s book “12 rules for life”.. I have one of my most depressive periods of my life as depression is often assoiciated with low serotonin levels but the under-educated version of me knew this as the scenario that I went back to square one - zero money, my former business partner not communicating anymore with me leaving me out in the abyss - questioning my own decisions.

But on a conceptual standpoint, I’m taking so much experience out of my way of processing decisions as I try to navigate my actions as encountering zero regrets as much as possible. I believe still that the things that I’ve learned from being swindled by a person you entrusted your wealth & efforts led me to this state where I can understand even the worst possible situations - like the genocide of jews done by the Nazis and the marxist ideologies that play with Gulag.



Lobsters have lived for 250 million years and is a fine specimen for studying the serotonin & its effects with our body, as both species run the same frame of function. Rule #1 of Dr. Petereson’s book says Stand up straight with your shoulders back is associated to us humans taking responsibility for ourselves so we won’t be a burden to the people around us and develop the capacity to take on bigger problems through progression. The hormone serotonin helps us to do that like lobsters identifying itself around its enviroment under the sea & its interaction with other lobsters in the area - through offensive and defensive stances.

This fundamental hormone had allowed us to map ourselves in where we stand with our relationships or even our role in the universe just like how lobsters do. Our lack of this hormone seemingly puts us in a downward spiral of depression and anxiety. Unfortunately, as I’ve said many times in this blog is we are ill educated to brain science.
